problems.title: Substring With Concatenation Of All Words (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
You are given a string s and an array of strings words. All the strings of words are of the same length.
A concatenated string is a string that exactly contains all the strings of any permutation of words concatenated.

Return an array of the starting indices of all the concatenated substrings in s. You can return the answer in any order.

Input Format:
First line: string s.
Second line: integer m (number of words).
Third line: m space-separated strings (words).

Output Format:
Print the starting indices on a single line, separated by spaces.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
barfoothefoobarman
2
foo bar

Sample Output
0 9

Explanation:
The substring starting at 0 is "barfoo". It is the concatenation of ["bar","foo"].
The substring starting at 9 is "foobar". It is the concatenation of ["foo","bar"].
problems.constraints:
1 <= s.length <= 10^4
1 <= words.length <= 5000
1 <= words[i].length <= 30
s and words[i] consist of lowercase English letters.

starterCodes.code:
class Solution:

if __name__ == '__main__':
    s = input().strip()
    m = int(input().strip())
    words = input().strip().split()
    sol = Solution()
    res = sol.findSubstring(s, words)
    print(' '.join(map(str, res)))

hintsList: Think about how to use a sliding window to optimize the solution.
Consider using a frequency map or two pointers to track the window state.
